post_text:
This evening Portsmouth Public Schools bestowed its highest teaching honor upon Rachael Lasky, a science teacher at William E. Waters Middle School. She was named the 2019 Portsmouth Teacher of the Year (TOY) at a special “Shining Stars” celebration held to honor the school division’s Teachers of the Year. The event was held at Woodrow Wilson High School.

At the celebration three school level finalists were named. Mrs. Lasky, who ultimately was selected as the division-wide TOY, was also named the Middle School Teacher of the Year. Davina Williams, a 5th grade teacher at Churchland Academy Elementary School, and Arielle Darden, a science teacher at Churchland High School, were recognized as the Elementary Teacher of the Year and the High School Teacher of the Year, respectively.
PPS celebrates these great teachers and the many others who give their best to children each and every day.
